content.description:
Neither axis shows tick marks or a scale. The horizontal, or x, axis is labeled "Time (seconds)" and the vertical, or y, axis is labeled "Depth (centimeters)". 

Moving from left to right:

The curve begins at the origin.

The curve increases, gradually at first and becoming more steep.

The curve reaches its maximum steepness near the center of the graph in the first quadrant.

The curve continues to increase, but at a lesser and lesser rate, until it ends nearly horizontal at the upper right side of the window.

At time <math alttext="t equals 0"> <mi>t</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mn>0</mn> </math>, water begins pouring into an empty container at a constant rate. The water pours into the container until it is full. The situation is modeled by the given graph, where time, in seconds, is the independent variable and the depth of water in the container, in centimeters, is the dependent variable.
content.question: For which of the following containers would the graph be appropriate?

choices.label:
This is a right circular cylinder with circles at the top and bottom that are the same size.

The diameter of the cylinder is constant from the top of the cylinder to the bottom of the cylinder.

The top and bottom of the container are circles of the same size.

Moving from bottom to top, the width of the container narrows until reaching the midpoint vertically and then widens again until reaching the top.

Moving from bottom to top, the width of the container increases until reaching the midpoint vertically and then narrows again until reaching the top.

The top and bottom halves of the container are symmetric.

The top and bottom of the container are circles of the same size.

Moving from bottom to top, the width of the container narrows to reach its thinnest point and then increases up until the vertical midpoint.

At this point it has a width greater than the width of the circular base.

The width then narrows again and widens until reaching the top.

The top and bottom halves of the container are symmetric.

content.answer:
The top and bottom of the container are circles of the same size.

Moving from bottom to top, the width of the container narrows until reaching the midpoint vertically and then widens again until reaching the top.

The top and bottom halves of the container are symmetric.
